oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook, inside cover, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The inside front cover from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. This page shows a rough sketch of the intersection between Cedar and Vine Streets. A hand scrawled note asks about which corner an old house was situated. A second note responds according to the labeled drawing. Forms part of the William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook. 1 sketch : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eichbaum, William A., 1787-1873--Notebooks, sketchbooks, etc.
